intro: Sida potentilloides, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun. Sida potentilloides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and moderate growth habit.
